title: ad ap or hybrid kayle?
body:
Never played her, never will but I'm still looking for characteristics of each of the 3 and when to choose them.
From reading the abilities, ad crit seems the strongest with her e giving a buff and being up 24/7 but sucks until full build
ap seems to have more sustain and idk about hybrid.
but yea, pd + runaans will prob make all of them op

What are your thoughts?{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

replies.body: nashors is viable on kayle, therefore, nashors should always be bought on her. its too good an item to pass up. even though the CDR isnt that effective it still has such great compatibility with kayles kit and potential. gunblade, you only get spell vamp from her Q and maybe her splash E damage so it wont be put to its best use. triforce into AD, thats pretty viable on a lot of champs but i dunno about kayle. 1 thing i do know is, too much attack speed is overkill. dont have more than 3 of ANY attack speed items on her. her passive is fully proc'ed after 4-5 attacks and then her Q, after that having high AP with nashors will allow you to kite more effectively with less required attacking animations slowing you down aswell as getting a better heal and movespeed with her W which is more effective for skirmishes

AP with some attack speed is generally the most common. CDR is also important so that you can have e up constantly (requires 37.5% cdr) since her lategame damage is crippled if e is on cd, especially with ad builds. AD is much weaker midgame because none of the good AD items give cdr and none of them are very good standalone items.

Go full Ap with 2 attack speed items. {{item:3115}} {{item:3085}} {{item:3158}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3135}}. You can choose to buy zhonya's instead of buying a lich bane or just depend on your ult which have a really low cooldown if you have 40% CDR. Other than that u can swap out ionian boots for Mpen boots if u have scaling CDR runes or when you can have the blue buff. I wouldn't recommend going AD on kayle because of the lack of CDR AD items and most of kayle's skills scales with AP.  Another option is to play on-hit kayle with {{item:3931}} {{item:3115}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3158}} {{item:3091}} {{item:3085}}. You might want to swap something in the on hit build for a defensive item because you kinda don't need that much attack speed because you will already be at around max attack speed with 4 of the attack speed items.
